questions.text: A/E the following are associated with increase in calcium conductance -

options.label: A
options.text: Upstroke of the smooth muscle action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Plateau phase of the ventricular muscle action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

questions.text: A 34-year-old man presents with severe migraine headaches that are accompanied by hemiparesis. Genetic analysis confirms the suspicion of an inherited channelopathy. The membrane potential will depolarize by the greatest amount if the membrane permeability increases for which of the following ions?

A 17-year-old boy presents with complaints of ongoing muscle weakness. He has noticed difficulty in climbing stairs at home over the last several months, and he has recently stopped playing cricket due to difficulty in bowling, specifically in lifting his arm above his head. The patient takes no medications, and he has no family history of similar muscle weakness. On neurologic examination, he is unable to lift his arms or legs against resistance. He undergoes a muscle biopsy to evaluate the cause of his proximal muscle weakness. Electron microscopy of the specimen reveals sparse transverse tubules in some of the muscle fibres. Which of the following is the most likely consequence of this patient’s biopsy findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Impaired ATP production during muscle contraction

options.label: B
options.text: Impaired relaxation after sustained muscle contraction

options.label: C
options.text: Uncoordinated contraction of myofibrils within affected muscle fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Decremental force generation on repeated muscle stimulation

questions.correct_answer: C. Uncoordinated contraction of myofibrils within affected muscle fibres

questions.text: Which of the following characteristics of an axon is most dependent on myelination?

options.label: C
options.text: Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.text: A 79-year-old man is in the second post operative day after a lap cholecystectomy. He suddenly stands after being supine since the day of the operation. As a result , which of the following hemodynamic variables will increase?

A 25-year-old man presents to his physician for an annual physical examination. He instructs the subject to take a deep inspiration. During this manoeuvre, the physician detects a splitting of the second heart sound. Which of the following is the mechanism underlying this finding?

options.label: C
options.text: Delayed closing of the aortic valve

options.label: D
options.text: Delayed closing of the pulmonary valve

questions.correct_answer: D. Delayed closing of the pulmonary valve

questions.text: Which of the following organs has the highest arterio-venous oxygen differences under normal conditions?

A patient has an oxygen consumption of 240mL/min. His systemic arterial oxygen concentration is 180mL/L of blood and his pulmonary artery concentration is 160mL/L of blood. What is his cardiac output?
A 65-year-old woman with mitral prolapse is admitted to the hospital for evaluation of her cardiac function. Which of the following is the best indicator of the cardiac preload?
questions.correct_answer: D. Left ventricular end diastolic volume

questions.text: A balloon catheter is advanced from the SVC towards the heart. When the tip is in the RA, it is inflated to increase the atrial pressure by 5 mm Hg. An increase in which of the following is expected to occur in response to the elevated atrial pressure?

A 10-year-old boy presents with history of difficulty in running, jumping and keeping up with other children in races. Examination reveals a footdrop, weakness, sensory loss and reduced reflexes. He also has a decreased conduction velocity and an X-linked mutation of connexin 32, consistent with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease. The neuropathy and gait disorder result because connexin is an important component of which of the following?

Blood is transfused into a patient whose baroreceptors are not functioning. The bp in these individual increases from 100 to 150 mm Hg. The same volume of blood is later transfused into another individual whose baroreceptors are functional. The increase in bp in the second individual is from 100 to 125 mm Hg. What is approximate feedback ‘gain’ of the arterial baroreceptors in the second individual when they are functioning normally?

A patient with MI develops progressive dyspnea and hypoxemia suggestive of cardiogenic shock. She is transferred to the ICU and a Swan-Ganz catheter is inserted. The patient is found to have a pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 25 mm Hg, which is indicative of a decrease in which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.correct_answer: D. Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy while playing cricket in the park is hit by the fast moving ball and sustains a skull fracture which compresses the underlying brain tissue. Which of the following will occur in response to an increased intracranial pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood pressure and heart rate increase

options.label: B
options.text: Blood pressure and heart rate decrease

options.label: C
options.text: Blood pressure increases and heart rate decreases

options.label: D
options.text: Blood pressure decreases and heart rate increases

questions.correct_answer: C. Blood pressure increases and heart rate decreases

questions.text: An 72 year-old woman is brought to the with complaints of nausea, vomiting, muscle cramps, and generalized weakness. Laboratory analysis reveals significant hyperkalaemia. Elevations of extracellular potassium ion concentration will have which of the following effects on the nerve membranes?

options.label: C
options.text: Activity of the Na + - K + ATPase will decrease

questions.text: Which of the following will occur if blood flow to an alveolus is totally obstructed by a pulmonary thromboembolism?

options.label: A
options.text: V/Q ratio of the alveolus equals zero

options.label: B
options.text: Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

options.label: C
options.text: Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to the mixed venous Po 2

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in shunting in the lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

questions.text: A 80-year-old male with emphysema presents for his annual pulmonary function testing to assess the progression of the disease. As a result of alveolar septal de-partitioning in emphysema, there is a decrease in which of the following?

A 35-year-old female suffers from third degree burns over 75% of his body. Her effective circulating volume and renal perfusion pressure drop precipitously and the concentration of NaCl in the tubular fluid in the kidney decreases. These conditions will cause an increase in which of the following by the kidney?

A 35 year-old healthy male suddenly develops shortness of breath and fatigue. A chest X-ray reveals pneumothorax of the right lung possibly due to rupture of a bleb on the surface of the lung. Which of the following changes occur on lung function because of pneumothorax?

options.label: A
options.text: Intrapleural pressure in the affected area equals the atmospheric pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Chest wall on the affected side recoils inward

options.label: D
options.text: Mediastinum shifts to the affected side with each inspiration

questions.correct_answer: A. Intrapleural pressure in the affected area equals the atmospheric pressure

questions.text: A 80-year-old woman resents with polyuria and polydipsia. Blood analysis reveals hypernatremia and urinanalysis shows hypotonicity with increased free water clearance. In which of the following conditions is an increased free water clearance a hallmark of the disease?

An 38-year-old male is brought to the Emergency after being thrown from his motorcycle following a collision with a stationary trolley. It is determined that he has a brain transection above the pons. How will this lesion affect the control of breathing in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: He loses voluntary control over his respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Central chemoreceptors will no longer be able to exert any control over the ventilation

options.label: D
options.text: Involuntary control over respiration will be lost but voluntary control will be present

questions.correct_answer: B. He loses voluntary control over his respiration

questions.text: The cardiovascular responses to isotonic exercise include an increase in which of the following?
A spirometer cannot be used directly to measure all of the following except-

A 16-year-old adolescent boy is being treated with the macrolide antibiotic erythromycin complains of nausea, intestinal cramping, and diarrhoea. The side effects are the result of the antibiotic binding to receptors in the GI tract that recognize which gastrointestinal hormone?
An 85-year-old man has a cerebrovascular accident in the medulla and pons that completely eliminates all vagal output to the GI tract. Which of the following will be totally lost in this patient?

A 25-year-old man presents to the Emergency with shortness of breath. His OHDC was shifted from that for normal haemoglobin A depicted in the curve A in the figure given below to curve B. this finding is consistent with which of the following conditions?
questions.correct_answer: D. Recent transfusion with banked blood

questions.text: A 80-year-old man has a solid tumour that pushes against an airway, partially obstructing the airflow to the distal alveoli. Which point on the V/Q line of the O 2 - CO 2 diagram given below corresponds to the alveolar gas of the distal alveoli?
The following figure shows a forced expiration for a healthy person and a patient complaining of shortness of breath. The patient most likely has which of the following conditions?
The plasma levels of both ACTH and cortisol would be expected to be higher in which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal individuals after waking in the morning

options.label: B
options.text: Normal individuals who have taken dexamethasone

questions.correct_answer: A. Normal individuals after waking in the morning

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy with weakness affecting the proximal muscles is found to have a mutation of a gene that encodes for the protein dystrophin. Genetic alteration in dystrophin lead to progressive muscle weakness because dystrophin provides structural support to the sarcolemma by binding with which of the following?

A 36-year-old woman is found comatose in her kitchen by her husband and is brought to the Emergency of a nearby hospital. Blood gas analysis reveals normal Po 2 and a lower-than-normal arterial O 2 saturation. Which of the following conditions is most consistent with the findings?

A 61-year-old man had a cardiac arrest on the golf course. Almost 8 minutes of resuscitation, normal sinus rhythm with a blood pressure of 110/75 mm Hg is obtained. His neurologic examination done in the hospital one hour after the cardiac arrest reveals decorticate posturing and no eye opening in response to pain. The pupils are reactive. Oculocephalic and corneal reflexes are present but reduced bilaterally. All of the following are the physiological bases of decorticate posturing except?

options.label: A
options.text: Dominance of the excitatory reticulospinal pathway leading to rigidity of extensors in lower limbs

options.label: B
options.text: Rubrospinal excitation of flexors of upper limbs

options.label: C
options.text: Spasticity is due to facilitation of the gamma loop

options.label: D
options.text: Spasticity is due to inhibition of gamma loop

questions.correct_answer: D. Spasticity is due to inhibition of gamma loop

questions.text: Which of the following vasoactive agents is usually the most important controller of coronary blood flow?
After secretion of trypsinogen into the duodenum, the enzyme is converted into its active form, trypsin, by which of the following?
Inhibition of the sodium iodide symport would be expected to cause which of the following?
In addition to increasing the permeability of the collecting ducts to water, ADH increases the permeability of the collecting ducts to which of the following?

A 35-year-old woman presents with complaints of excessive bleeding during her periods and increasing fatigue and cold extremities. Laboratory investigations reveal a Hb of 7gm/dL. In this patient with anemia, which of the following would be reduced?

options.label: C
options.text: Percent O 2 saturation in the arterial blood

questions.text: A stroke that destroys the respiratory area of the medulla would be expected to lead to which of the following?

A 70-year-old man with a 40-year history of alcoholism and liver disease visits his physician because of sudden weight gain. One year ago, the man had a BMI of 24.9 kg/m2 and today his BMI is 28.5 kg/m2. Physical examination shows a pitting pedal oedema and moderate ascites. Which condition is most likely to have promoted the development of both ascites and peripheral oedema in this patient?
The renal clearance of phosphate is increased by which of the following hormones?
Which of the following is not produced by osteoblasts?

A 35-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with severe kyphoscoliosis and respiratory muscle weakness. Which of the following physiological variables is most likely to be decreased in this patient?

A 70-year-old male with small cell carcinoma of the lung presents with lethargy, confusion and muscle cramps. Lab investigations reveal elevated ADH levels, possible from the ectopic production of ADH. In patients with SIADH, which of the following will increase?

A 75-year-old woman has a mass in the sella turcica that compresses the portal vessels, disrupting pituitary access to hypothalamic secretions. The secretion rate of which hormone would most likely increase in this patient?

A 15-year-old boy playing in his garden accidentally steps on a broken bottle with his bare right foot. His right leg immediately lifts up while his left leg extends even before he cries out in pain. Which of the following best describes the type of reflex and the centre involved in this reflex?

A 73-year-old man sustained a lower back injury that causes severe chronic pain. His physician prescribes analgesics for the pain and benzodiazepines to help him sleep. Which of the following best describes why this man has difficulty sleeping without medication?

options.label: A
options.text: Excitation of amygdala by slow pain fibres

options.label: B
options.text: Excitation of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

options.label: C
options.text: Depression of amygdala by slow pain fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Depression of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

questions.correct_answer: B. Excitation of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

questions.text: A 20-year-old man, victim of road traffic accident is brought to the Emergency and is diagnosed with hemisection of the left side of the spinal cord at C6. Which of the following function is likely to be lost in the right leg of this man?

A 12-year-old girl fell from her bicycle and sustained a head injury. She develops a fever of 39 degrees Celsius which is unrelated to an infection or inflammation. The fever is most likely due to a lesion of which of the following?
Precentral gyrus, corticospinal and corticobulbar tracts are essential for which of the following?
Synaptic transmission between the pain fibres from the viscera in the pelvis to spinal cord neurons is mediated by which of the following?

A 69-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital because of agitation and aggression. Three years prior to admission, her irregular, flicking movements had become so severe that she could not walk or look after herself. Huntington chorea affects which of the following areas of the brain?

A 70-year-old woman with multiple sclerosis and increasing spasticity is treated with an intrathecal infusion of baclofen, a GABA B agonist which mediates pre-synaptic inhibition. Presynaptic inhibition in the CNS affects the firing rate of α-motor neurons by which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing the potassium permeability of the pre-synaptic nerve ending

options.label: B
options.text: Increasing the potassium permeability of the α-motor neuron

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperpolarizing the membrane potential of the α-motor neuron

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing the amount of neurotransmitter released by the pre-synaptic membrane

questions.correct_answer: A. Increasing the potassium permeability of the pre-synaptic nerve ending

questions.text: The circadian rhythm is controlled by which hypothalamic nucleus?
A 50-year-old patient with a past h/o cirrhosis undergoes a total colectomy. Removal of the entire colon would be expected to cause which of the following?

A group of university students visit Khardungla at 5600 metres. On arrival, few of the students experience mental and muscle fatigue, and complain of headaches, nausea, and dyspnoea. Which of the following will be decreased in these patients?

A medical student is studying the fluid exchange in skeletal muscle capillaries in a laboratory animal. He determines that fluid is being filtered out of the capillaries with a net filtration pressure of 10mmHg. He obtains the following values – Capillary hydrostatic pressure is 45mmHg Capillary oncotic pressure is 25 mmHg Interstitial oncotic pressure is 10mmHg Which of the following is the interstitial hydrostatic pressure?
If helium oxygen mixture rather than nitrogen-oxygen mixture is given to a deep sea diver, which of the following will be observed?

options.label: A
options.text: Risk of decompression sickness is reduced

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of O2 toxicity is reduced

questions.correct_answer: A. Risk of decompression sickness is reduced

questions.text: A 22- year-old man is planning to run the 10k when he goes to visit his brother in Leh. Because of the high altitude, he decides to leave early for the event. While in Leh, he experiences extensive cramping and spasms in his calf muscles while running, symptoms he seldom experienced in Delhi. Lab tests reveal hypocalcemia. Which of the following is the reason high altitude predisposes to tetany?

options.label: A
options.text: Low oxygen tension decreases his skeletal muscle blood flow

options.label: B
options.text: Low oxygen tension increases the skeletal muscle lactate

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma proteins are more ionized under alkalotic conditions which provide more protein anion to bind with Ca++

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation of the sodium-potassium ATPase reduces the plasma concentration of free ionized calcium

questions.correct_answer: C. Plasma proteins are more ionized under alkalotic conditions which provide more protein anion to bind with Ca++

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents with the chief complaint of intermittent mid-epigastric pain that is relieved by antacids or eating. Gastric analysis reveals that basal and maximal acid outputs exceed normal values. The gastric acid hypersecretion can be explained by an increase in the plasma concentration of which of the following?
The diagram below illustrates single isometric twitch contractions of two skeletal muscles, A and B, in response to a depolarizing stimulus. Which of the following best describes the muscle A?

options.label: A
options.text: Adapted for slow and sustained contraction

questions.correct_answer: D. Innervated by larger nerve fibers

questions.text: The body fluid volume changes in a 34 year old patient are shown below in Darrow-Yannet diagram (solid line – normal, dotted line – patient). Which of the following is the cause of this patient’s condition?

A 68-year-old patient is recovering from acute lung injury following a diffuse pulmonary viral infection. The cell type responsible for the regeneration of the patient's alveolar epithelium is also functions in:

A 75-year-old overweight male patient reports frequent urination, and his blood pressure is 160/100 mm Hg. Based on a 24-hour inulin clearance, his GFR is estimated to be 150mL/min. his plasma glucose is 400mg/dL. Assuming that his renal transport maxima for glucose is 300mg/min, as shown in the figure given below, what would be the approximate rate of urinary glucose excretion for this patient?

In the following graph, plasma concentration is given on the x-axis and renal clearance of different substances is given on the y-axis. Which of the following depicts the renal clearance of para-amino hippuric acid?
Which of the following parts of the cerebellum is involved in planning of sequential movement?
Shown in the graph given below is the time taken by four receptors for adaptation. Which line represents the Pacinian corpuscles?
An increase in the shear stress in a blood vessel is likely to cause which of the following changes?

The following graph shows the force-velocity relationship for isotonic muscle contractions of skeletal muscles. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the force- velocity relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: More the force or the afterload, less is the velocity of contraction

options.label: B
options.text: V max is when the afterload is zero

options.label: C
options.text: When Velocity = zero contraction is completely isometric

options.label: D
options.text: Less the afterload, less is the tension generated in the muscle

questions.correct_answer: D. Less the afterload, less is the tension generated in the muscle

questions.text: Most of the following GI secretions have a basal output during the inter-digestive period (between meals). However, the sight and smell of a tasty meal stimulates GI secretions. Of the various GI secretions, which is the most stimulated?

The pleural pressure of a normal 40-year-old male is approximately -5 cm H 2 O during resting conditions immediately before inspiration (i.e., at FRC). What is his pleural pressure during inspiration?
In a patient with severe central diabetes insipidus caused by a complete lack of ADH secretion, which part of the tubule would have the lowest tubular fluid osmolality?

Shown below is the location of the high –pressure baroreceptors Physiology PG clamps the carotid sinus at ‘A’ and ‘B’ separately (i.e. in 2 separate experiments), He is likely to observe which of the following change in BP respectively:

A research scientist attempts to understand the influence of carbon dioxide content in blood on its oxygen binding. The scientist adds carbon dioxide to dog blood and measures the uptake of oxygen in the blood versus oxygen pressure in the peripheral tissue. He notes in one dog that with the addition of carbon dioxide with a pressure of 90 mmHg, the oxygen pressure in the peripheral tissue rose from 26 to 33 mmHg. How can this phenomenon be explained?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding of O2 to hemoglobin in lungs drives release of CO2 from haemoglobin

options.label: B
options.text: The sum of the partial pressures of CO2 and O2 cannot exceed a known threshold in blood

options.label: C
options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

options.label: D
options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues causes alkalemia, which is necessary for O2 unloading

questions.correct_answer: C. High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

questions.text: Which of the following graphs best describes the relationship between Pco 2 and alveolar ventilation (V A ), when the Pco 2 is changed acutely over a range of 35 to 75 mm Hg?
Which of the following reflexes is correctly paired with its receptor?
questions.correct_answer: D. Autogenic inhibition- Golgi tendon organ
